name: CafeScribe
overview:
CafÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©Scribe (http://www.CafeScribe.com) is a Facebook for brainiacs. Yup, for students or business professionals who want to collaborate around textbooks or any other document, CafeScribe is your thing.

Upload any type of document (yes, like scribd) or buy an e-Book or e-Textbook and start sharing notes. Any note you add to your document or e-Book is broadcast on CafeScibe. Anyone else can subscribe to your notes or thoughts. Anyone can rank how well they think your notes are by giving a thumbs up or thumbs down or rank your “genius” level.

You can also upload, annotate and share their own books and documents. At the core of CafÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©Scribe is MyScribe, a free downloadable reader that functions as a way to organize and annotate PDFs and other documents (like iTunes, but for documents). It also lets people connect and share documents with other members of the CafÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©Scribe community.

Based in Salt Lake City, Utah, CafÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©Scribe is a technology company dedicated to helping students and professionals get better, cheaper textbooks that let them learn more efficiently. They recently launched the world’s first musty-smelling e-books by offering a scratch & sniff sticker that smells like old books with every e-book purchase.
